articles.title: The largest ever penguin species has been discovered in New Zealand - The Natural History Museum
articles.description: Kumimanu fordycei weighed an estimated 150 kilogrammes, demonstrating that penguins became large early in their evolution.
articles.content:
The largest living penguin is the emperor penguin, with the biggest individuals weighing around 45 kilogrammes and standing around 1.2 metres tall. But in the past penguins were much bigger.
